meanings.definition: Persuade someone to do or believe something, typically by use of deception.
meanings.sent1: He tried to con his friend into lending him money.
meanings.sent2: The scam artist managed to con many people out of their savings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous boy attempted to con his sister into trading her toy for his.
meanings.sent4: Her smooth talk and sly smile could con anyone into buying her products.
meanings.sent5: The con artist's silver tongue could convince even the most skeptical individuals.

meanings.definition: An argument or vote against a proposal.
meanings.sent1: She presented a strong con against the new policy.
meanings.sent2: The cons raised during the meeting led to a heated debate.
meanings.sent3: The con presented by the opposition was well-reasoned and logical.
meanings.sent4: His con was like a sharp arrow piercing through the flawed proposal.
meanings.sent5: The powerful con swayed many members to reconsider their support for the plan.

meanings.sent1: One con of living in the city is the noise pollution.

meanings.sent3: The main con of the job was the long commute to the office.
meanings.sent4: The con of the new technology was its high cost.
meanings.sent5: She weighed the pros and cons before making a decision.
